Body: Possible Duplicate:  How do I project the screen of my android phone for a presentation?  I want to live stream my Android phone while I'm playing a game. So far, my attempt is to stream my Android's screen to my mac, then from my mac, live stream it using Procaster.So what do I need to accomplish this? I don't have a rooted phone. I just got it so I don't want to void my warranty at any time soon.If my approach isn't the best way to do it, what can you suggest? I've already read ( How do I project the screen of my android phone for a presentation? ) but the solutions provided there are for rooted phones.
Title: How do I stream my Android screen to my mac?

history.Text: I want to live stream my Android phone while I'm playing a game. So far, my attempt is to stream my Android's screen to my mac, **then** from my mac, live stream it using [Procaster][1].So what do I need to accomplish this? **I don't have** a rooted phone. I just got it so I don't want to void my warranty at any time soon.If my approach isn't the best way to do it, what can you suggest? I've already read ( http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/5652/how-do-i-project-the-screen-of-my-android-phone-for-a-presentation ) but the solutions provided there are for rooted phones.  [1]: http://new.livestream.com/broadcast-live/encoder
How do I stream my Android screen to my mac?

So far, my attempt is to stream my Android's screen to my mac, **then** from my mac, live stream it using [Procaster][1].So what do I need to accomplish this? **I don't have** a rooted phone. I just got it so I don't want to void my warranty at any time soon.If my approach isn't the best way to do it, what can you suggest? I've already read ( http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/5652/how-do-i-project-the-screen-of-my-android-phone-for-a-presentation ) but the solutions provided there are for rooted phones.  [1]: http://new.livestream.com/broadcast-live/encoder
